item.title: Covid: Fully jabbed arrivals from France must still quarantine
item.description: A planned relaxation of England's rules from Monday will not apply due to cases of the Beta variant.

item.title: Europe floods: At least 120 dead and hundreds unaccounted for
item.description: As many as 1,300 people are still unaccounted for after the worst flooding in decades.

item.title: UK plans biggest flu vaccine rollout this winter
item.description: Free vaccines will be offered to more than 35 million people, including more teenagers than ever before.

item.title: Covid: Six people can meet in homes as Welsh lockdown rules ease
item.description: Lockdown relaxed as law restricting the number people meeting outside is scrapped in Wales.

item.title: Covid misinformation on Facebook is killing people - Biden
item.description: The US president said a spike in Covid deaths among the unvaccinated was down to social media.

item.title: Mystery 19th Century botanist tracked down following appeal
item.description: Pressed flowers and a poem found inside a centuries-old botany book sparked a quest to find the owner.

item.title: The migrants hunger-striking for legal status in Belgium
item.description: More than 400 go without food demanding a clear path to residency in Belgium.

item.title: US wants giant radar in UK to track space objects
item.description: It comes amid growing concern about congestion, competition and even an arms race in space.

item.title: Bianca Devins: Family sue NY officials over video footage of murdered teen
item.description: Bianca Devins' family claim video of her having sex and also her murder were shared with the media.

item.title: UK looks to extend ivory ban to hippos and other animals
item.description: Ministers say elephants are not the only animals at risk from hunters, as they launch consultation.

item.title: Covid: UK daily cases pass 50,000 for first time since January
item.description: It comes after England's chief medical officer warned hospitalisations could hit "scary numbers".

item.title: Inhaler: Bono's son and his band top UK chart with debut album
item.description: Elijah Hewson's rock group knock Olivia Rodrigo off the top spot with their debut album.

item.title: The Papers: 'French holiday chaos', and 'world watching' PM
item.description: Several of Saturday's papers lead with the last-minute changes to quarantine advice for travellers.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How are young people responding to the jab?
item.description: The Covid vaccine is now being offered to all over 18s. So what has uptake been like for young people?

item.title: Ros Atkins on… the North America heat waves
item.description: Ros Atkins explains the link between climate change and recent heat waves in the US and Canada.

item.title: Covid: Coping with opening-up anxiety
item.description: Lauren and Angelica-Jane fear the end of restrictions will be challenging for their mental health.

item.title: Week in pictures: 10 - 16 July 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Amputee's win for prosthetics funding in Wales shows 'people power'
item.description: David Bradley said amputees in Wales had been disadvantaged compared to the rest of the UK.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival 2021 highlights: Sun, stars and saliva
item.description: A-listers flocked to the Cannes Film Festival's red carpet, despite the pandemic.

item.title: In pictures: Floods kill dozens in Germany and Belgium
item.description: Record rainfall caused rivers to burst their banks, leaving at least 122 dead in Germany and Belgium.

item.title: Germany floods: Where are the worst-hit areas?
item.description: Maps, images and graphics showing the heavy rainfall and flooding that has caused widespread damage.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: What's behind the violence and looting?
item.description: Some analysts say the violence wasn't spontaneous anger but a deliberate strategy of sabotage.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: 'Not having the vaccine is the biggest mistake of my life’
item.description: The number of Covid patients in Bradford Royal Infirmary is rising sharply - and half are unvaccinated.

item.title: Showman doctor: From travelling fairgrounds to the Covid frontline
item.description: Doctor John Castle says his nomadic childhood helped prepare him for the pressures of the pandemic.

item.title: Stephen Fretwell: 'Gavin and Stacey song was as good as a part-time job'
item.description: Stephen Fretwell on his hit TV show theme tune and why his 13-year music hiatus has come to an end.

item.title: Why the Scouts are launching a money badge after Covid
item.description: Why Scouts are lending a hand on tackling financial literacy in the wake of the pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19: Second doses run dry in Brazil's scramble to vaccinate
item.description: Many are struggling to source their second dose of the Covid-19 jab in one of the worst-hit countries.

item.title: Germany floods: How a country was taken by surprise
item.description: Amid the despair and mounting death toll, people are questioning how this could have happened.

item.title: Oosthuizen leads Open after day two - highlights and report
item.description: Louis Oosthuizen heads into the weekend with a two-shot lead at The Open after players enjoyed benign conditions on Friday.

item.title: Livingstone hits England's fastest ever century in vain as hosts lose to Pakistan
item.description: Liam Livingstone's spectacular 42-ball hundred cannot prevent England from being beaten by Pakistan in a riotous first Twenty20 at Trent Bridge.

item.title: Hamilton tops British GP qualifying as 86,000 descend on Silverstone
item.description: Lewis Hamilton thrills a crowd of 86,000 at Silverstone to take pole position for Saturday's new sprint race at the British Grand Prix.

item.title: Mohoric wins as Cavendish denied chance to break Tour stage wins record
item.description: Matej Mohoric wins stage 19 of the Tour de France, denying Mark Cavendish an opportunity to break the record for stage wins he shares with Eddy Merckx.

item.title: Lions have to look at themselves after first tour defeat - Dawson
item.description: Former British and Irish Lion Matt Dawson says the team "have to look at themselves" after their loss to South Africa A on Wednesday.

item.title: Castleford & St Helens make sacrifices to ensure Challenge Cup final can go ahead
item.description: Castleford and St Helens players make lifestyle changes and sacrifices to help Saturday's Challenge Cup final at Wembley go ahead.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: 'Covid passports': How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England could have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing when restrictions end on 19 July?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules take effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory in England from 19 July, but will remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: Molesey Lock: Lightning-strike selfie lands siblings in hospital
item.description: Rachel, Isobel and Andrew Jobson were injured as they took the photo during a thunderstorm.

item.title: How your driving might reveal early signs of Alzheimer's
item.description: Research shows how small changes in the way you drive could expose preclinical signs of disease.

item.title: 'Neptune' appears in the waves during storm in Newhaven
item.description: The image resembling the Roman god of water was captured as waves crashed over a harbour wall.

item.title: Couple to participate in every Olympic sport
item.description: The sporting challenge is in memory of Stuart Bates' brother, who died of motor neurone disease.

item.title: Super Mario 64 game sells for record-breaking $1.5m at auction
item.description: An original Zelda cartridge and a Mario game set successive records at auction within days.
